author: Dorothy Rabinowitz
title: A ‘Roseanne’ for Our Times
text: Within its first half hour the sparkling, if somewhat message heavy, “Roseanne” reboot touches on every major social problem in America today, including the one resulting from the recent presidential election. Their election choices have caused a furious dispute between Roseanne (Roseanne Barr), a Trump voter, and her sister, Jackie (Laurie Metcalf), who chose Green Party star Jill Stein. This, it turns out, is the easiest solved of the thorny issues up for discussion in the packed Conner household. The sisters forgive one another, grudgingly. What they don’t do—as is true of most people who’ve experienced ruptured relationships...
